name: PrefigureDiscounts
description:
List the discounts that potentially could be activated.

A order or user can be given to look at the context of the order or user. When order is given the user will be ignored and the customer of the order will be used (if present)

If a `ProductIDs`, `ProductSearchID` or `ProductSearch` is set, the service will check if the resulting products are a eligible to one or more discounts. If an `OrderID` is provided, the context of the given order is taken into account, that can include user specific discounts, order OU specific discount, etc.

Be aware that:
- If `ProductIDs` is given, `ProductSearchID` and `ProductSearch` are ignored
- If `ProductSearchID` is given, `ProductIDs` and `ProductSearch` are ignored
- If `ProductSearch` is given, `ProductIDs` and `ProductSearchID` are ignored
auth_description: This service does not require authentication.

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

request_samples.name: JSON
CURL

H.name: AvailabilityCalculationMethod
H.description:
Determines how bundle availability is calculated. By default the bundle is said to be available when all required lines of the bundle have at least
one option that has stock. The alternative is that the bundle is only considered available when the default product for each line has stock.

If not provided then the value of the `ProductBundleAvailabilityCalculationMethod` EVA setting is used.
Possible values:

* `0` - AnyOptionHasStock
* `1` - DefaultOptionHasStock

H.name: IncludeBundleInformation
H.description:
When the availability of a bundle is calculated it means that all the products that are part of the bundle become part of the output of
GetProductAvailability. If this option is turned on, the service will also return information about the bundle to make sense of those extra products.

J.name: CountryID
J.description: Limit OrganizationUnits within the area to those with the provided country. Optional.

L.name: Center
L.description: Defaults to the coordinates of the selected OrganizationUnit when not set, but a RadiusInKm is set.

L.name: CountryID
L.description: Limit OrganizationUnits within the radius to those with the provided country. Optional.

I.name: InArea
I.description: Select the organizations that are considered for carry-out based on a rectangular area defined by the top-left and bottom-right co-ordinates.

I.name: InRadius
I.description: Select the organizations that are considered for carry-out based on a circular area defined by the center co-ordinate and a radius (specified in km).

I.name: IncludeCarryOutOrganizationUnits
I.description:
If specified as true the response will contain the pickup organizations. Which organizations are included depends on the rest of the request:

- If a rectangular area is specified through `InArea` it will contain the organizations within the area.
- If the radius is specified through `InRadius` it will contain the organizations within the radius of the given center co-ordinates.
- If an explicit list of organizations is specified through `OrganizationUnitIDs` then those are returned.

In all cases, whether or not all of them are returned or only those that contain stock is determined by `IncludeOrganizationUnitsWithoutStock`. By
default only organizations with stock are returned.

If the request specifies more than one product, the organization will only be returned if *all* products have stock (unless
`IncludeOrganizationUnitsWithoutStock` is `true`).

I.name: IncludeOrganizationUnitsWithoutStock
I.description:
If specified as true then all relevant shop OrganizationUnits are returned, whether they have available stock or not.

Defaults to false and only has effect if `IncludeCarryOutOrganizationUnits` is set to `true`.

I.name: OpeningHoursType
I.description:
When the carry-out organizations are returned, this determines what returned opening-hours are returned. See each value of the enum for details.
Possible values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - NextSevenDays
* `2` - CurrentWeek
* `3` - Regular

I.name: OrganizationUnitIDs
I.description:
This can be optionally used to provide a list of shops for which you would like to check carry-out availability.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

M.name: AvailabilityDate
M.description: Include the expected date on which the provided products can be home-delivered.

N.name: AvailabilityDate
N.description: Include the expected date on which the provided products can be picked-up from a shop.

N.name: InArea
N.description: Select the organizations that are considered for pickup based on a rectangular area defined by the top-left and bottom-right co-ordinates.

N.name: InRadius
N.description: Select the organizations that are considered for pickup based on a circular area defined by the center co-ordinate and a radius (specified in km).

N.name: IncludeOrganizationUnitsWithoutStock
N.description:
If specified as true then all relevant pick-up OrganizationUnits are returned, whether they have available stock or not.

Defaults to false and only has effect if `IncludePickupOrganizationUnits` is set to `true`.

N.name: IncludePickupOrganizationUnits
N.description:
If specified as true the response will contain the pickup organizations. Which organizations are included depends on the rest of the request:

- If a rectangular area is specified through `InArea` it will contain the organizations within the area.
- If the radius is specified through `InRadius` it will contain the organizations within the radius of the given center co-ordinates.
- If an explicit list of organizations is specified through `OrganizationUnitIDs` then those are returned.

In all cases, whether or not all of them are returned or only those that contain stock is determined by `IncludeOrganizationUnitsWithoutStock`. By
default only organizations with stock are returned.

If the request specifies more than one product, the organization will only be returned if *all* products have stock (unless
`IncludeOrganizationUnitsWithoutStock` is `true`).

N.name: OpeningHoursType
N.description:
When the pickup organizations are returned, this determines what returned opening-hours are returned. See each value of the enum for details.
Possible values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - NextSevenDays
* `2` - CurrentWeek
* `3` - Regular

N.name: OrganizationUnitIDs
N.description:
This can be optionally used to provide a list of shops for which you would like to check pick-up availability.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

N.name: OrganizationUnitType
N.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Shop
* `2` - WebShop
* `4` - Container
* `8` - Pickup
* `16` - Warehouse
* `36` - Country
* `64` - Franchise
* `128` - EVA
* `256` - TestOrganizationUnit
* `512` - DisableLogin
* `1024` - Supplier
* `1024` - ExternalSupplier
* `3072` - Consignment
* `4096` - B2b
* `8196` - Region
* `16384` - ReturnsPortal
* `32768` - Restitution
* `65536` - RepairCenter
* `131072` - Mobile
* `262144` - ConcessionStore

N.name: Type
N.description:
This field lets you specify whether the pickup availability date you get back (in case you requested it) for each product should be based on your
current OrganizationUnit, or whether it should be the OrganizationUnit that has the earliest availability for the product. Defaults to FastestShop.
Possible values:

* `0` - FastestShop
* `1` - CurrentShop

O.name: IncludeSuppliers
O.description:
Determines whether or not the detailed information for the requested organization(s) recursively includes the stock details of their suppliers as well.
Defaults to false if both OrganizationUnitIDs and ProductIDs is left empty, otherwise it defaults to true.
Setting this to false limits the response size in case you only care about the stock details of the specific requested organization(s).

O.name: OrganizationUnitIDs
O.description:
Which organization(s) to get the details for, defaults to the OrganizationUnitID provided in the request or to your current organization.

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

O.name: ProductIDs
O.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

G.name: Bundles
G.description: Contains options that allow you to influence how bundle availability is calculated.

G.name: Delivery
G.description:
Contains options that let you influence if and how delivery availability is calculated. If not specified at all then no delivery availability is
calculated and returned.

G.name: IncludeRelatedStockReplacingProducts
G.description: If set to true then the availability of related stock replacing products is returned.

G.name: Pickup
G.description:
Contains options that let you influence if and how pickup availability is calculated. If not specified at all then no pickup availability is
calculated and returned.

G.name: ProductAvailabilityDetails
G.description:
In addition to the normal data, additional detailed information can be returned for the provided OrganizationUnits and Products.

This information includes the entire supplier hierarchy for each OrganizationUnit, telling you where stock originates from, where it's currently committed.

Also includes information about expected future stock and allocation assignments.

Providing this field as an empty object is interpreted as a request to include this information for all organizations and products.

G.name: QuantityAvailable
G.description: If set to true then the QuantityAvailable is returned. By default this information is only accessible to Employee-type users.

F.name: AvailabilityOptions
F.description: If something is defined in these options, the GetProductAvailability results will be added to the response

F.name: IncludePrefigureDiscounts
F.description: Include the results of a PrefigureDiscounts call in the result

F.name: IncludeSerialNumberConfiguration
F.description: Include the product serial number configuration

F.name: OrderID
F.description:
Order to use for additional options

This is the ID of a `Order`

C.name: Explain
C.description: If Explain is set to true the response will contain an explanation of how the search was performed. This is ignored if you do not have the ProductSearchExplanations functionality.

C.name: IncludedFields
C.description: This is the ID of a `ProductPropertyType`

C.name: ProductSearchTemplateID
C.description: This is the ID of a `ProductSearchTemplate`

C.name: UserTypeOverride
C.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Employee
* `2` - Customer
* `4` - Anonymous
* `8` - Business
* `17` - System
* `64` - Debtor
* `256` - LimitedTrust
* `512` - Tester
* `1024` - RemovedByRequest
* `2048` - Api
* `4096` - Impersonated

B.name: OrderID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Order`

B.name: ProductIDs
B.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

B.name: ProductSearchID
B.description: This is the ID of a `ProductSearchTemplate`

B.name: UserID
B.description: This is the ID of a `User`

S.name: Code
S.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

S.name: Message
S.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

S.name: RequestID
S.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

S.name: Type
S.description: A short description of the error type.

T.name: ExternalIDs
T.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

T.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
T.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

T.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
T.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

Y.name: DateTimeValue
Y.description: Used for datatype DateTime and Date

Y.name: NumberValue
Y.description: Used for datatype Integer and Decimal

Y.name: StringValue
Y.description: Used for datatype String, Text and Enum

BE.name: ProductRequirementID
BE.description: This is the ID of a `ProductRequirement`

BC.description: This is the ID of a `PersonalizedPromotion`

BC.name: ProductIDs
BC.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

BF.name: DiscountID
BF.description: This is the ID of a `Discount`

BF.name: ID
BF.description: This is the ID of a `DiscountCoupon`

BI.name: PersonalizedPromotionID
BI.description: This is the ID of a `PersonalizedPromotion`

U.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Order
* `2` - Line
* `3` - Both

U.name: CustomFieldValuesWithOptions
U.description: This is the ID of a `CustomField`

U.name: DiscountID
U.description: This is the ID of a `Discount`

U.name: EligibleProductIDs
U.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

U.name: LayerID

Possible values:

* `1` - Manual
* `2` - Coupon

* `5` - Loyalty
